text:
When the HtmlParser was fed the attached HTML file, it failed to produce the
URLs for the following two images:

powrdbyhp_blu_84x28_yahoo.gif - produced the URL for the HTML page itself.

031121_l300.gif - produced nothing
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
woolfel@yahoo.com
text: thanks for the bug report. i will look into it after the holidays.

I managed to take a look on my commute home and the bug appears to be real.
Using the sample provided, a couple image tags were mised. Part of the problem
was how I am using HTMLParser and the other bug is with HTMLParser's
ImageScanner class. In some cases, it appears the src attribute is not parsed
correctly. I verified an image tag is created, but the src is not parsed properly.
creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
Perhaps the HTML file could be added to the testfiles/ directory, and used in 
the JUnit test?

[This would mean distributing the source with JMeter - would this be a problem?]

By the way, trying to download the attachment gives an error:
 "Attachment ID should be numeric"
I presume that is a bug in Buzilla.

I managed to debug and fix it. it will require merging the fix with the latest
code. I should have time on sunday to check in the fix.
creator: woolfel@yahoo.com

text:
I just checked in the patches to fix HTMLParser. I will also follow up with the
maintainer of HTMLParser.
peter
creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
